query: Take an appropriate amount of C and add it to B, then pour the mixture of A and D into B. What happens next?

original_scene.description: A is a pot of water. B is six identical cups. C is a bottle of water-absorbing resin. D is three bottles of pigments, red, yellow and blue.

key_step_1.conclusion: Take three cups in B and add equal amounts of C, fill the other three cups with A and add one of D respectively. Since C is not in contact with A, there is no change in the cup containing C.

key_step_2.conclusion: Pour the cups containing A and D into the cup containing C. The hydrophilic groups in C interact with water molecules to form osmotic pressure, and the porous structure of C promotes water molecules to enter the resin through capillary action.

final_scene.annotation: C absorbs the mixture of A and D.

subject: mechanics
